name: Rocket Propulsion
description: This course provides an in-depth study of the fundamentals of rocket propulsion, covering topics such as propulsion theory, engine types, fuel chemistry, and the practical applications of rocket technology.

name: Aerodynamics
description: This course offers a comprehensive exploration of aerodynamics, focusing on the principles and applications of airflow and its effects on flying objects.

name: Spacecraft Design
description: This course delves into the principles and practices of spacecraft design, offering students a detailed understanding of the engineering and technology behind spacecraft systems.

name: Organic Chemistry
description: Organic Chemistry is an in-depth course that explores the structure, properties, composition, and reactions of organic compounds and materials.

name: Inorganic Chemistry
description: Inorganic Chemistry focuses on the properties, structures, and behaviors of inorganic and organometallic compounds.

name: Physical Chemistry
description: Physical Chemistry merges the principles of physics and chemistry to understand the physical properties of molecules, the forces that act upon them, and the chemical reactions they undergo.

name: Ancient Languages and Scripts of Middle-earth
description: This course offers an exploration of the ancient languages and scripts found throughout Middle-earth, including Elvish, Dwarvish, and the Black Speech of Mordor.

name: Wizards, Elves, and Men: Inter-species Diplomacy in Middle-earth
description: This course explores the complex relationships and diplomatic interactions among the different races of Middle-earth: Elves, Men, Dwarves, and Wizards.

name: History and Practice of Middle-earth Magic
description: This course delves into the mystical and magical aspects of Middle-earth, examining the sources, practitioners, and manifestations of magic.

name: Principles of Democratic Education
description: This course examines the foundations of democratic education, emphasizing the role of education in fostering civic responsibility, critical thinking, and social equality.
